intro: Leptodermis potaninii var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf leptodermis, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Thailand and Vietnam. This species thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
